Tasks

  • Menu Bar

Menu Bar¶

If you have the required permissions, you can select a user whose tasks you wish to view in the menu bar.

You can also specify the position of the detail area.

Selecting a user¶

Note

This function is only available if you have the required permissions.

When you start CONTACT Tasks, your tasks (the tasks assigned to the registered user) are displayed.

On the right-hand side of the menu bar, you can select another user whose tasks you wish to view.

  1. Click the name field for the user.
  2. Enter the name of the user whose tasks you wish to view in the text field.
  3. Enter text to filter the users available for selection. Matching user names are displayed in a selection list.
  4. Select the user.
  5. The tasks assigned to the selected user are displayed.

Note

For performance reasons, the user’s role assignment is stored each time the user logs on. To view a user’s tasks, the user must have logged on previously.

Positioning the detail area¶

Use the Position detail area button to place the detail area below the table or to the right of the table.

Grouping bar¶

The column headers of the table selected for the grouping are displayed in the grouping bar.

You can drag one or more column headers from the table to the grouping bar. Your tasks are then grouped in the table according to the selected column header.

Note

To group the tasks in the table, move the cursor to the top end of the column header. Once you are in the correct position, a horizontal blue bar will appear in the column header and the cursor will be replaced with a cross. You can then drag the column header to the grouping bar.

You can also group tasks in the editing options area.

If you have grouped tasks into several columns, you can alter the order of the grouping as required in the grouping bar.

  1. Move the cursor over a column header in the grouping bar.
  2. Left-click and hold on the column header.
  3. Move the column header to the new position.
  4. Release the button.
